title: How to Make Broccoli Soup With Japanese Wild Mushrooms

steps.headline: Place the broccoli florets in the water and cover.
Heat a small knob of butter in a pan with a little olive oil.
Toss the mushrooms with the whole garlic clove in the hot oil.
steps.description: The garlic clove is there to lightly "perfume" the mushrooms, not so much to flavour it.

steps.headline: Season with freshly ground salt and pepper & a squeeze of lemon juice.
Add the parsley, toss, remove, and discard the garlic clove.
Remove the florets from the water after about 4 minutes, but keep the water to a bubble.
Blend the florets in a food processor.
steps.description: Take the water off of the heat and add a little to the broccoli puree. Puree and add water until you get the desired consistency.

steps.headline: Pour the soup into a bowl.
steps.description: Top with the sauteed mushrooms. Drizzle with olive oil and give it a grind of pepper.

text: Boil lightly salted water.  Place the broccoli florets in the water and cover.  Heat a small knob of butter in a pan with a little olive oil.  Toss the mushrooms with the whole garlic clove in the hot oil. The garlic clove is there to lightly "perfume" the mushrooms, not so much to flavour it. Season with freshly ground salt and pepper & a squeeze of lemon juice.  Add the parsley, toss, remove, and discard the garlic clove.  Remove the florets from the water after about 4 minutes, but keep the water to a bubble.  Blend the florets in a food processor. Take the water off of the heat and add a little to the broccoli puree. Puree and add water until you get the desired consistency. Season with salt and pepper.  Pour the soup into a bowl. Top with the sauteed mushrooms. Drizzle with olive oil and give it a grind of pepper.
